block.p: NASCAR--Fined crew chief Joe Garone $50,000 for using an illegal liquid brake cooling device during Save Mart 350. Deducted 50 driver points from Scott Pruett and 50 owner points from Cal Wells.
NASCAR--Fined crew chief Joe Garone $50,000 for using an illegal liquid brake cooling device during Save Mart 350. Deducted 50 driver points from Scott Pruett and 50 owner points from Cal Wells.

American League BALTIMORE ORIOLES--Signed 3B Tripper Johnson, RHP Richard Bartlett, C Thomas Arko, 1B Doug Gredvig, OF Brandon Littleton, RHP Jayme Sperring, C Michael Russell, C Kristopher Wilken, RHP Ryan Keefer, LHP Brian Forystek, OF Thomas Joyce, LHP Joel Crump, SS Shayne Ridley, RHP Aaron Bouie, SS Jose Rodriguez and RHP Dan Marchetti. BOSTON RED SOX--Placed OF Trot Nixon on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled 1B-DH Morgan Burkhart from Pawtucket of the International League. CLEVELAND INDIANS--Activated RHP Paul Shuey from the 15-day disabled list. Designated LHP Alan Newman for assignment. OAKLAND ATHLETICS--Activated LHP Mike Magnante from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned LHP Rich Sauveur to Triple-A Sacramento of the PCL.
National League LOS ANGELES DODGERS--Waived RHP Orel Hershiser. SAN DIEGO PADRES--Activated RHP Steve Montgomery from 15-day disabled list. Optioned RHP Brandon Kolb to Las Vegas of PCL.

MIAMI HEAT--Acquired F-C Chris Gatling and a 2000 second-round draft pick from Denver for G Voshon Lenard and F Mark Strickland. MILWAUKEE BUCKS--Traded F Robert Traylor and F J.R. Reid to the Cleveland Cavaliers and G Vinny Del Negro to the Golden State Warriors. Cleveland sent G Bob Sura to Golden State and Golden State sent F Jason Caffey and F Billy Owens to Milwaukee. NETS--Named Byron Scott coach.

JETS--Waived RB Leon Johnson. SAN DIEGO CHARGERS--Signed DE Jonathon Brown to a two-year contract. SAN FRANCISCO 49ERS--Waived DB Ryan Roques. WASHINGTON REDSKINS--Signed S Quincy Sanders to four-year contract. Released WR Cory Allen.

Arena Football League NEW JERSEY RED DOGS--Fired Frank Mattiace, coach, and Amod Field, offensive coordinator. Named Kevin Guy interim coach-general manager and announced QB coach Charlie Cocuzza will serve as offensive coordinator. Indoor Professional Football League IPFL--Awarded a franchise to Trenton, N.J. and announced the team nickname will be Lightning.
National Hockey League BOSTON BRUINS--Signed RW Lee Goren. CHICAGO BLACKHAWKS--Re-signed D Kevin Dean.
International Amateur Athletic Federation IAAF--Suspended high jumper Javier Sotomayor until July 31, 2001, for cocaine use.

BLOOMFIELD--Named David Vivino women's soccer coach. CALIFORNIA--Named Ron Witmeyer assistant baseball coach. CCNY--Named Ronaldo Salomon men's and women's tennis coach. COASTAL CAROLINA--Named Allen Terrell director of golf and men's golf coach. COLUMBIA--Announced the resignation of Lou Montano, wrestling coach. CORNELL--Named Ray Wright football scouting and college personnel director. NEBRASKA--Announced freshman RB Chris Butler would transfer to Auburn. Announced the suspension of C Kimani Ffriend and G John Robinson from the basketball team for violating team rules. SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY--Named Sandy Pugh women's basketball coach. TEMPLE--Named Gaye Chapman women's assistant basketball coach. TULSA--Named Steve Gulley cross country and track and field coach. UNLV--Signed football coach John Robinson to a contract through the 2002 season.
